title: Pete Hegseth - Sexual Assault & Drinking Allegations
summary: Trump appointed Fox News host Pete Hegseth as Defense Secretary despite $50,000 sexual assault settlement, allegations of excessive drinking at work, and sworn affidavit from ex-sister-in-law saying he's 'unfit' and ex-wife 'feared for her safety.' Confirmed 51-50, narrowest margin.
keyFacts: $50,000 settlement to woman who accused him of sexual assault at 2017 Republican women's conference
Police report: Woman said he 'physically blocked her from leaving hotel room,' took her phone, 'remembered saying no a lot'
Emergency room nurse contacted police after treating woman who 'may have been drugged and raped'
Multiple allegations of excessive drinking and being intoxicated at work - 'open secret' at Fox News
Former sister-in-law submitted sworn affidavit: 'Unfit for the position of secretary of defense'
Affidavit: Ex-wife 'feared for her personal safety,' 'often hid in a closet'
Affidavit: Ex-wife had code word system to signal she needed help to escape
Affidavit: Said 'women should not vote or work'
No experience running large organizations; leads 3 million personnel and $850 billion budget
Confirmed by narrowest margin: 51-50 with VP Vance casting tiebreaking vote
